summary: A formal Touhy request letter from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC to the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, seeking production of documentary evidence related to a victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The letter is part of civil litigation and aims to obtain records to support the victim's claims in the Epstein Victim Compensation Program or formal litigation.

connections.description: Edwards is representing the victim in her civil case and is seeking evidence on her behalf.
Epstein sexually abused the victim from 2002 to 2010, starting when she was 17, and provided her with gifts, flights, housing, and medical treatments.
Edwards, as an attorney, is formally requesting evidence from Berman, the U.S. Attorney, via a Touhy request.

events.title: Start of Abuse

events.title: Touhy Request Submission
events.description: Edwards Pottinger LLC submitted a formal Touhy request to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York seeking evidence related to the victim.

locations: 425 North Andrews Avenue Suite 2, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301

keyFacts: The document is a formal Touhy request from attorneys representing a victim of Jeffrey Epstein, seeking documentary evidence from the DOJ to support her civil claims.
The victim, referred to as Jane Doe, was sexually abused by Epstein from 2002 to 2010, starting when she was 17 years old.
Epstein provided the victim with medical treatments, legal counsel, commercial flights, housing, and items of value, records of which are believed to be in the Government's possession.
The request aims to obtain evidence for the Epstein Victim Compensation Program or ongoing civil litigation (SDNY Case No. 1:19-cv-07773).
The letter indicates the victim's identity is known to the prosecutors but is being protected via pseudonym in the lawsuit.
